answers.answer: With my first son I didn't go into labor until 5 days before his due date and the only reason for that was because I had preeclampsia so at my Dr's visit they asked if I was ready to meet my lil guy and I was like no lol my husbands at work and I need to go drop my car off and get my bags, they told me that I could go do all that stuff but to come straight back to the hospital after I was done so I did as I was told. I arrived at the hospital at about 11am and we didn't get a room until about 4pm (it was super busy there, thank heavens I wasn't in labor) once we got a room they hooked me up to an IV and the fetal monitor and gave me pitocin to induce labor, well my lil guy did not want to come out I stayed dilated to 2cm all the way until the next morning so at 8am the next morning they decided to break my water after that things went pretty quickly and I had my son at 4:50pm the next day. I'm currently 26 weeks and 5 days pregnant with my second son and I have no idea when this lil guy will arrive, but my Dr thinks that he will arrive early because I had the preeclampsia with my first but we will see =0)

Well with my first I had him at 36.5 weeks =) He weighed 8.5 pounds and was 20 inches! He had no problems besides a little bit of jaundice which made him stay under the lights for 2 days and then had to check his levels for the next 7 days after we went home. My water broke and he was sunny side up and I too received pitocin to help with dilation and 3.5 hours of pushing... NO pain meds either...(14.5 hours of labor)My second boy I was 38 weeks and my water broke at home again @ around 9 pm got to the hospital at 11 pm, had an epideral, pushed for 3 minutes and baby was here no problems whatsoever. He has been seriously healthy =)I think you won't know until the time comes to see how long it is going to take (she could come early or be up to two weeks late! HEAVEN FORBID!) and hopefully your doctors make sure that you are not overdue!

My first pregnancy my water broke 2 weeks early just randomly since I wasn't having contractions or anything or at least not ones I could feel. Most first time pregnancies though end up going past the due date. Both of my close friends who were pregnant went about 5 days to a week past their due date. One of them was 80% effaced and at 2 cm from 36 weeks on and ended up being late.

Thanks for the info ladies I was just wanting to know what to expect. I am going to talk to my Ob the next time I see her and see what she says. I am hopeing that Naomi will come on time or early. It would be nice to have her at the end of September. I guess I will see what happens.

This whole time I've been thinking mine will come early. I just have that feeling....if I end up being late then holy, I'm way off! LOL I'm 25 weeks tomorrow and when I was going through stuff I realized that I'll need a hospital bag, so I got out my one luggage case and put it aside so I could fill it up. It's way early for that probably but that's the way I am I guess.

I never "went into labor"... I was induced so i wouldn't know... but don't do it, not a good idea unless it's absolutely necessary!As for this baby, I'm a little scared of what going into labor will actually be like... will I be at the store when my water breaks? Will I be in labor forever? I dunno... with my daughter it was only 4 hours from the time my water broke... with this one I'm scared it might be longer since i'm not being induced.Although I'm really hoping that this baby comes at the end of September. My due date is October 3rd so I'm not hoping for a really early baby, just maybe like 4-5 days earlier than expected.

My last pregnancy I was convinced I was going to be late. I was sure of it the whole time I was pregnant. I never had an contractions I never had any symptoms of impending labor and than 2 weeks before my due date my water just randomly broke and I had to be induced. I would say just be prepared for anything!

I had my son exactly 2 weeks late.  I had my membranes stripped twice, and the second time finally put me into labor.  Typically they say you are more likely to go into labor later than your due date with your first, and that after that your more likely to be a little earlier.  Every women is different, and I swear genetics has a little something to do with it.  My mom was 2 weeks late with both my sister and I, I'm hoping this time I'm not late!  Going past 40 weeks is not fun!
My due date was august 10th I was induced august 14 my daughter was born August 15th I think this baby will probably be late too lol just a feeling

question: I was wanting to know from your ladies experience when you went into labor or gave birth with your first child? I am getting ready to be 27 weeks and I was just started to wonder when I could expect to go into labor. I would really appreciate any info you ladies can give me.
title: When should I expect to go into labor?
